similaranime.anime: Kachou Ouji: Hard Rock Save the Space

recommendations.recommendation: Cheap animation, dull soundtrack, some undeveloped characters (Takatsukasa) and crumpled-up ending. Still, GTO-like approach makes this worth a watch. For fans only.
Great good guy / feel good / rags to riches anime. Also, for all GTO fans.
If you like GTO it`s a must see series
you shall just see, it`s preaty good. Like GTO but more oriented on society and the main "hero" is not so meshugga

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch2492 [Yajima Kintarou] used to be the charismatic leader of a biker gang. Then he retired to have a family. With his wife dead in childbirth, and all alone with a baby boy, Kintarou now embarks upon a new adventure — as the strangest salaryman in all of Japan. Source: ANN

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: mafia
tag.description: A mafia is a type of organized crime syndicate whose primary activities are protection racketeering, the arbitration of disputes between criminals, and the organizing and oversight of illegal agreements and transactions. Secondary activities may be practiced such as gambling, drug trafficking, loan sharking, and fraud. The term was originally applied to the Sicilian mafia, but has since expanded to encompass other organizations of similar methods and purpose, such as in "the Russian mafia" or "the Japanese mafia", and is applied informally by the press and public, but the criminal organizations themselves have their own terms; for example, the original Sicilian and Italian-American mafia call themselves "cosa nostra", while the Japanese mafia calls itself "yakuza". Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: friendship
tag.description: The feeling of trust, kindness, and friendship between a group of high school students for example, is a central theme of this anime.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: politics
tag.description: From commies to fat capitalist pigs, all the stuff done by the "guys with the power", mainly evil tactics for gaining more power over the masses. Watching this title may remind you why CNN is boring.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: crime
tag.description: The underworld we talk about here is not to be confused with the place where people are believed to go after they die, but the general term for organized crime. It is a shady world, unknown to most people, where illegal things like murder, smuggling, drug dealing and similar are happening daily. Groups known to be acting in this world are for example the mafia or the yakuza.

tag.name: law and order
tag.description: Where there is "wealth", there are criminals. It is up to the civil law enforcement, i.e. detectives, Police or Special Squads, to keep the lawless activities in the real world or in cyberspace under control. Note: Do not confuse this with Military presence.

tag.name: police
tag.description: The police (civil servants) are the good guys in the battle against crime. Though they try hard, they are usually outclassed by super-criminals or criminal organizations in anime, requiring the help of special units or some lone hero.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: manly tears
tag.description: Somewhere down the line, it became the "norm" that boys don`t cry. The scenario does not matter; shedding tears is the ultimate no-no in terms of what you can and cannot do as a man (at least in the West, anyway). But there comes a time when a man`s emotions do get the better of him, and they pour forth - as prerequisite an impassioned speech may or may not be present - by cascading down his cheeks. These are what we like to call "manly tears". Extremely powerful. Not limited but often used in hot-blooded / super robot shows. Examples include Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar, Getter Robo and Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann. The opposite of manly tears are "girly tears".

character.name: Yajima Kintarou
character.description: Yajima Kintarou is a college drop-out and former leader of a bike gang who now works as a "salaryman" at Yamato Construction.

character.name: Mita Zenkichi
character.description: Mita Zenkichi is one of the biggest political fixers in Japan.

character.name: Fudousan`ya
character.description: Realtor who rents to Kintarou.

character.name: Nakazawa
character.description: Nakazawa works in the General Affairs Department. He is jealous of how Kazue and the other office girls swoon over Kintarou.

character.name: Saeki Kazue
character.description: Kazue-chan is one of the office girls in the General Affairs Department. She recognises Kintarou immediately, as she used to have (and still has) a huge crush on him.

character.name: Maeda Ichirou
character.description: Maeda Ichirou is a senior architect at Yamato Constructions. He befriends Kintarou early on, as he enjoys using the pencils Kintarou has sharpened. He was captain of his university judo club.

character.name: Yamato Morinosuke
character.description: Yamato Morinosuke is the founder and chairman of Yamato Constructions. An old man who worked his way to the top from being a construction worker, he is not afraid of a scrap or two. He enjoys fishing. Stranded with a dead engine on one of his fishing trips, with the tide carrying him out, he had given up hope when Kintarou came swimming to save him. In return, he promises Kintarou a salaryman position in his firm, and it all begins ...

character.name: Ooshima Genzou
character.description: Ooshima Genzou became President of Yamato Constructions after retiring from the Ministry of Construction. Using his bureaucratic connections, he pushed Yamato Constructions into profitability by snagging lucrative government contracts. His hidden agenda, though, was to take over Yamato Constructions by acquiring shares through various fronts. This share acquisition was funded by illegally siphoning money from Yamato itself. His plans came to naught, and he was dismissed as President at the board meeting where he intended to dismiss Yamato Morinosuke as Chairman.

character.name: Kakei Torishimariyaku
character.description: Director Kakei is a core member of President Ooshima`s faction. He comes from the Ministry of Finance.

character.name: Suenaga Mimi
character.description: Suenaga Mimi is the daughter of Suenaga Misuzu with her previous partner, the influential politician Kuroda. Combining the freshness of youth with her mother`s beauty, she has found fame as an idol, aided in no small part by her nude gravure photobook.

character.name: Suenaga Misuzu
character.description: Suenaga Misuzu, ex-mistress of a powerful politician, is the beautiful proprietress of the Jardin, a high-profile bar in Ginza. It is a place where the rich and powerful come to unwind, and a place where many deals are done in the shadows.

character.name: Sakurai Kyouko
character.description: Sakurai Kyouko is secretary to Yamato Morinosuke.

character.name: Shiina Suu
character.description: Shiina was part of the Hasshu league when Kintarou was commanding it. He is now a yakuza boss, having taken command of his late father`s gang. He is engaged to Kanzaki Chieko.

character.name: Takeda Torishimariyaku
character.description: Managing Director Takeda is one of the core members of President Ooshima`s faction.

character.name: Mizuki Mamoru
character.description: Mizuki Mamoru is an executive in the Accounts department. He happens to live next door to Kintarou.

character.name: Tanaka Masakazu
character.description: Tanaka Masakazu is in Sales. He was a member of his university`s karate club.

character.name: Kaminaga Hiroshi
character.description: Kaminaga Hiroshi was one of the first employees of Yamato Constructions, and has worked with the Chairman from the very beginning. He enjoys gardening.

character.name: Fujii Torishimariyaku
character.description: Director Fujii was with President Ooshima in the Ministry of Construction, where he was Chief of Housing. He joins the President`s faction in Yamato Constructions.

character.name: Kurokawa Yuusaku
character.description: Kurokawa Yuusaku was one of Yamato Constructions` early employees, who worked his way to the top as an Executive Director. Initially forced out by President Ooshima`s faction, he returned to become President himself.

character.name: Ishikawa Gorou
character.description: Ishikawa Gorou used to work in Accounts. His talent with computers led him to inadvertently hack into the accounts database and access secret information. Because of this, he was moved to Personnel, where he eventually becomes Section Chief.

character.name: Yamato no Tsuma
character.description: Yamato Morinosuke`s wife. She is a wise woman who has stood by her husband and supported him through thick and thin.

character.name: Akemi
character.description: Akemi was a blind girl with whom Kintarou fell in love. He eventually married her and settled down as a fisherman. She died while giving birth to their only child, Ryuuta.

character.name: Yuki no Haha
character.description: Yamato Morinosuke`s daughter, Yuki`s mother.

character.name: Mizuki Kazuki
character.description: Mizuki Mamoru`s son. He is preparing for his university entrance exams, going to cram school. After seeing his father get beaten up by yakuza without putting up a fight, he turns truculent, but is snapped out of it by Kintarou. He treats Ryuta as his kid brother.

character.name: Mizuki Kinue
character.description: Mizuki Mamoru`s wife.

character.name: Esawa Yuki
character.description: Yuki-chan is Yamato Morinosuke`s granddaughter. She develops a schoolgirl crush for Kintarou after he saves her from a car crash.

character.name: Rumiko
character.description: Rumiko is a transsexual hostess, considered to be the No. 1 in Roppongi. She used to be a member of Kintarou`s Hasshu League, going by the name of Hagimoto Toru.

character.name: Sawano Torishimariyaku
character.description: Sawano is one of the directors in the President`s camp.

character.name: Kurosaki
character.description: Kurosaki was the head of the Haneda Hikouki, a rival bike gang. He joined Kintarou`s Hasshu League during the course of the mega-run.

character.name: Harumi
character.description: Harumi was employed as a maid at Yamato Morinosuke`s country house. Hard of hearing, she was mistrustful of men, until she met Kintarou. Meeting him gave her the courage to go ahead with her omiai.

character.name: Arai Noriaki
character.description: Arai is one of the young guns of Yamato Constructions, rapidly making his way to the top.

character.name: Kaminaga Ayako
character.description: Kaminaga Ayako is Kaminaga Hiroshi`s wife.

character.name: Takano Torishimariyaku
character.description: Director Takano is one of the members of Chairman Yamato`s faction.

character.name: Kiosk Obasan
character.description: Magazine kiosk lady, who gets the shock of her life when Kintarou is thrown into her booth after being hit by a train.

character.name: Sportscar no Otoko
character.description: Young punk with whom Yuki is hanging out to get back at Kintarou.

character.name: Oootoko
character.description: A mountain of a man, he is an ex-cop, currently acting as one of Mita Zenkichi`s enforcers.

character.name: Shuei
character.description: Security guard at Yamato Construction`s main office back entrance.

character.name: Tadokoro
character.description: Tadokoro is one of Kakei`s lackeys from Finance, tasked with reading out the summary at the board meeting.

character.name: Itani
character.description: Itani is one of the directors of Yamato Constructions. He is asked to act as the moderator during the motion to dismiss the President.

character.name: Kurasawa
character.description: Kurasawa is one of the directors in the President`s camp. He switches allegiance during the dismissal vote.

character.name: Okami
character.description: Mita Zenkichi`s housekeeper.

character.name: Kanzaki Chieko
character.description: Kanzaki Chieko is Shiina`s fiance. In the past, her father was Kintarou`s father`s fellow gang member.

character.name: Matsui
character.description: Matsui is a General Manager with the Ushikiya Supermarket chain. Kintarou catches him feeling up http://anidb.net/ch36316 [Kanzaki Chieko] on the subway, but spares him humiliation. In gratitude for that, he recommends Yamato Constructions for Ushikiya`s upcoming contracts.

character.name: Kanai Buchou
character.description: Kanai Buchou is a chief at one of Yamato Construction`s clients.

character.name: Senmu
character.description: Director with Ushikiya Supermarkets.

character.name: Yoshie
character.description: Yoshie is a girl who works at the workmen`s shacks at the tunnel construction site. She is saved by Kintarou from being molested by http://anidb.net/ch36352 [Higuchi].

character.name: Hitotsubashi Shingo
character.description: Hitotsubashi Shingo is an ex-sumo wrestler who now has his eponymous construction company. In his sumo days, he was taken in by the politician Kuroda as he was from the same region of Japan. He therefore knows http://anidb.net/ch36033 [Suenaga Misuzu], and used to carry around http://anidb.net/ch36032 [Suenaga Mimi] as a baby.

character.name: Yamauchi
character.description: Yamauchi is a construction worker with Hitsotsubashi.

character.name: Kimura Hiroshi
character.description: Kimura Hiroshi is an ex-member of the Hasshu League (Joutou division), and was part of the Special Attack Corps. He is now with Hitotsubashi Constructions as a site worker.

character.name: Kizu
character.description: Kizu is a construction worker with Hitotsubashi.

character.name: Higuchi
character.description: Higuchi is a construction worker with Hitotsubashi. He has his nose broken by Kintarou when he is caught trying to molest http://anidb.net/ch36347 [Yoshie].

character.name: Okazaki
character.description: Okazaki was the site supervisor at the Kousen Tunnel construction. He was involved in a slush fund used to generate black money for funding President Ooshima`s political ambitions.

character.name: Koudan Jichou
character.description: Vice-director of a public corporation attending the tunnel completion ceremony.

character.name: Yajima Mitsuko
character.description: Yajima Mitsuko was Kintarou`s mother. She died when he was still in elementary school.

character.name: Kintarou (Shougakusei)
character.description: Yajima Kintarou when he was in elementary school.

character.name: Ookawa
character.description: Ookawa was the original founder of the Hasshu League. He recruited Kintarou after seeing him get into a fight with his gang members.

character.name: Takatsukasa Seiji
character.description: Takatsukasa Seiji is a hot-shot Tokyo University law graduate, head-hunted from a government post personally by President Kurokawa, with an eye to being the future President of Yamato Constructions.

character.name: Kanzaki
character.description: Kanzaki is a yakuza boss. In his youth, Kintarou`s father took the fall for him, allowing him to move to Tokyo and move up the yakuza ranks.

character.name: Oba
character.description: Kintarou`s aunt, on his mother`s side.

character.name: Oji
character.description: Kintarou`s uncle, on his mother`s side.

character.name: Oyabun
character.description: Yakuza boss executed by http://anidb.net/ch36838 [Kanzaki]. Kintarou`s father took the fall for this as Kanzaki was just starting a family.

character.name: Doujima
character.description: Doujima is Nakamura Kayo`s bodyguard.

character.name: Handa Shirou
character.description: Handa Shirou is an official with the City Planning Department.

character.name: Murakami
character.description: Murakami is the manager of the north east branch of Yamato Constructions.

character.name: Kuramoto Ichirou
character.description: Kuramoto Ichirou is the President of Hokuto Constructions. He was formerly a bureaucrat.

character.name: Ishiguro
character.description: Ishiguro is with Hokuto Constructions.

character.name: Katsuno
character.description: Katsuno is with Shibahata Constructions.

character.name: Okamoto
character.description: Okamoto is with the design department. He likes golf and baseball.

character.name: Imai
character.description: Imai is a journalist with Kahoku Construction News.

character.name: Ooshita
character.description: Ooshita is with the Design department of Yamato Construction`s north east division.

character.name: Tenpou-gumi Kumichou
character.description: A yakuza boss in Kahoku.

character.name: Tabe
character.description: Tabe is the founder and owner of Tabe Constructions.

character.name: Hobo
character.description: Kindergarten worker at Ryu`s nursery.

character.name: Kuroda Seishirou
character.description: Kuroda was a powerful and influential politician. Suenaga Misuzu was his mistress, and Suenaga Mimi his daughter.

character.name: Yajima Ryuuta
character.description: Ryuuta is Kintarou`s son with Akemi.

character.name: Yajima Teruo
character.description: Kintarou`s father.

episode.title: 金太郎 女心を揺らす
Kintarou Steals a Girl`s Heart
Kintarou Onnagokoro o Yurasu
金太郎 大暴走する
Kintarou Runs Wild
Kintarou Daibousousuru
金太郎 大いにもてる
Kintarou Becomes Very Popular
Kintarou Ooini Moteru
金太郎 大物に屈せず
Kintarou Doesn`t Impress Me
Kintarou Oomono ni Kusezu
金太郎 美鈴と恋する
Kintarou Falls in Love With Misuzu
Kintarou Misuzu to Koi Suru
金太郎 社命を受ける
Kintarou Takes His Orders From the Company
Kintarou Shamei o Ukeru
金太郎 現場をしめる
